dojg.description: A phrase indicating someone’s decision to cope with a negative situation, or a simple, straight forward reason for his/her action.

examples.japanese: (ksa).もしTOEFLの点が悪かったらもう一度受けるまで(のこと)だ。
examples.english: If my TOEFL score isn't good, then I'll just take the test  again.

examples.japanese: (ksb).日本語は面白そうだったので、取ったまで(このと)だ。
examples.english: I took Japanese language only because it looked interesting  (not for any other reason).

examples.japanese: (a).結婚できなかったら、一生独身で仕事をするまでのことだ。
examples.english: If I cannot marry I will just stay single for the rest of my  life and do my work.

examples.japanese: (b).就職できなかったら、フリーターになるまでのことだ。
examples.english: If I cannot get a regular job, I will just become a permanent  part-time worker.

examples.japanese: (c).バスが来ないんなら歩いて帰るまでだ。
examples.english: If a bus doesn't come, I will just walk home.

examples.japanese: (d).夕食にどうぞと言われたから彼女のアパートに行ったまでだ。とやかく言われる筋合いはない。
examples.english: I went to her apartment just because she invited me over to  dinner. You have no right to say such a critical thing to me.

examples.japanese: (e).小説みたいなものを書いたが、別に小説家になりたいと思ったのではない。小説を書くということがどんなことか知りたかったまでのことだ。
examples.english: I've written something like a novel, but I never particularly  thought I wanted to be a novelist. I just wanted to know what it was like to  write a novel. That's all.

examples.japanese: (f).あなたに私の個人的なことを話したのは、あなたの将来に多少役立つかと思ったまでのことです。
examples.english: The reason I told you about my personal matters is just because  I thought it would be useful for you in the future. Nothing more and nothing  less.
